verses.text: Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*, The heaven \add is\add* my throne, and the earth \add is\add* my footstool: Where \add is\add* the house that ye build unto me? And where \add is\add* the place of my rest?

For all those \add things\add* hath mine hand made, And all those \add things\add* have been, saith the \sc Lord\sc*: But to this \add man\add* will I look, \add Even\add* to \add him that is\add* poor and of a contrite spirit, And trembleth at my word.

He that killeth an ox \add is as if\add* he slew a man; He that sacrificeth a lamb, \add as if\add* he cut off a dog’s neck; He that offereth an oblation, \add as if he offered\add* swine’s blood; He that burneth incense, \add as if\add* he blessed an idol. Yea, they have chosen their own ways, And their soul delighteth in their abominations.

I also will choose their delusions, And will bring their fears upon them; Because when I called, none did answer; When I spake, they did not hear: But they did evil before mine eyes, And chose \add that\add* in which I delighted not.

Hear the word of the \sc Lord\sc*, ye that tremble at his word; Your brethren that hated you, That cast you out for my name’s sake, said, Let the \sc Lord\sc* be glorified: But he \add shall\add* appear to your joy, and they shall be ashamed.
A voice of noise from the city, a voice from the temple, A voice of the \sc Lord\sc* that rendereth recompence to his enemies.
Before she travailed, she brought forth; Before her pain came, she was delivered of a man child.

Who hath heard such \add a thing?\add* who hath seen such \add things?\add* Shall the earth be made to bring forth in one day? \add Or\add* shall a nation be born at once? For as soon as Zion travailed, she brought forth her children.
Shall I bring to the birth, and not cause to bring forth? saith the \sc Lord\sc*: Shall I cause to bring forth, and shut \add the womb?\add* saith thy God.
Rejoice ye with Jerusalem, and be glad with her, all ye that love her: Rejoice for joy with her, all ye that mourn for her:
That ye may suck, and be satisfied with the breasts of her consolations; That ye may milk out, and be delighted with the abundance of her glory.

For thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*, Behold, I will extend peace to her like a river, And the glory of the Gentiles like a flowing stream: Then shall ye suck, ye shall be borne upon \add her\add* sides, And be dandled upon \add her\add* knees.
As one whom his mother comforteth, so will I comfort you; And ye shall be comforted in Jerusalem.

And when ye see \add this\add*, your heart shall rejoice, And your bones shall flourish like an herb: And the hand of the \sc Lord\sc* shall be known towards his servants, And \add his\add* indignation towards his enemies.
For behold, the \sc Lord\sc* will come with fire, And with his chariots like a whirlwind, To render his anger with fury, And his rebuke with flames of fire.
For by fire and by his sword will the \sc Lord\sc* plead with all flesh: And the slain of the \sc Lord\sc* shall be many.

They that sanctify themselves, and purify themselves in the gardens Behind one \add tree\add* in the midst, Eating swine’s flesh, and the abomination, and the mouse, Shall be consumed together, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
For I \add know\add* their works and their thoughts: It shall come, that \add I\add* will gather all nations and tongues; And they shall come, and see my glory.

And I will set a sign among them, And I will send those that escape of them unto the nations, \add To\add* Tarshish, Pul, and Lud, that draw the bow, \add To\add* Tubal, and Javan, \add to\add* the isles afar off, That have not heard my fame, neither have seen my glory; And they shall declare my glory among the Gentiles.

And they shall bring all your brethren \add for\add* an offering unto the \sc Lord\sc* out of all nations Upon horses, and in chariots, and in litters, and upon mules, and upon swift beasts, To my holy mountain Jerusalem, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, As the children of Israel bring an offering In a clean vessel \add into\add* the house of the \sc Lord\sc*.
And I will also take of them for priests \add and\add* for Levites, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
For as the new heavens and the new earth, which I \add will\add* make, \add Shall\add* remain before me, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, So shall your seed and your name remain.
And it shall come to pass, \add that\add* from one new moon to another, And from one sabbath to another, Shall all flesh come to worship before me, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.

And they shall go forth, and look Upon the carcases of the men that have transgressed against me: For their worm shall not die, Neither shall their fire be quenched; And they shall be an abhorring unto all flesh.
